Articles.Content:
About a month or so ago, some of you may remember me posting a thread asking for advice on a new PC. Most said build my own, some suggested others, and finally I settled on this baby:

http://www.newegg.ca/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229285

I was a bit concerned of the reviews, bad PSU or DOA or faulty graphics card etc. I decided to buy it anyway, and if the PSU failed, I'd replace it. If it didn't, good. Plus the 1 year cyberpower warrenty+ newegg 30 day made for good protection.

So far, I don't have a lemon.

Details:

Shipping: Ordered on the 5th, recieved on the 12th. No damage at all, perfect condion thanks to purolator

First impressions: This is a large PC. Well, bigger than my older PC.

Keyboard: I'm using it right now. I like it, it has buttons for my computer, internet, sound, search, etc. Nice feel to it, red WASD and arrow keys. I love red, so yay!

Mouse: Very... ergonomical. DPI ajuster, middle mouse wheel, back/forth on IE buttons, weight control, so far very good.

The case: I love this, AZZA did a great job. Sleek, clean, and RED LEDS when you turn it on.

So far,

This game on max= crazy fps:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyFn_DCjwz4

Could max it, but I don't care. I stil play it with awesome graphics at awesome FPS:

Same here:

Maxed:

Maxed again:

Dis maxed:

Just cause 2 kinda minimal, but still great. (I take it easy on the machine, I want good graphics but I don't need it maxed. Srsly, JC2 at 20% of max settings is already realistic for me)

Not my vids, just showing.

And Minecraft 60 FPS maxed with Sphax 128x texture pack

One little issue that has occoured since 5 days ago: Whenever I start it up, it hums a bit louder for a minute. Honestly, it just sounds like a normal PC waking up turning its fans on to med to start up.

Satisfied so far.

Hey cam!

Oh, and this can run KSP smoothly now, even on kerbin, awesome. Old pc took 5 min to load new ship to launch, new pc 5 seconds

I also have a video, jsut a simple little "Test".

(if you can't see it its probably still processing)

EDIT:

This PC was only $520 total, so thats a good deal, in my opinion.
Glad you are having success with it. Glad we were so forceful in telling you what to buy
it looks like a good deal for the build. Looks like plenty of room for upgrades down the road so youll enjoy it.
